page.title: 12Employment in Hunton
page.content: Very few people who live in Hunton actually work here. The shop and two pubs are{small family businesses, }as is the dairy which provides work for two men. Two others also deliver milk to surrounding villages. We see{local {farmers}about during the day or maybe the{Police Constable }who is stationed in Hunton. One couple makes knitwear in their home and a gentleman produces jewellery. The local builder employs several villagers,but other labourers, joiners and carpenters work away. The two Sadlers have a{repair garage }and operate {taxis }in nearby towns. A few residents do{part-time jobs}near home. Ladies machine knit, are cleaners or volunteer for Meals on Wheels eaten by some of the{55 retired people}here,but {all others in full employment commute, civil servants,soldiers,teachers, shop assistants,reps, nurses,firemen etc.
